doc.title: From Time to Time
doc.plot: The emotional arc of a woman's life is drawn in an amalgam of dance, drama and the music of Joni Mitchell. In a choreography by Ginette Laurin, seven songs from Mitchell's Both Sides Now and Travelogue form the backbone of a narrative exploring a single life-interpreted by dancer Emma Lu Romerein-from the early flirtations of youth to the disappointments and compromises of adulthood. Along the way, the film touches on the idealism of the sixties, the sexual and social turbulence of the eighties and nineties, and the promise of the new millennium. With the participation of dancers Ted Banfalvi, Roberto Campanella and Rex Harrington.
